data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions have the sequence: Take 9 steps left. In reverse order: Take 10 steps forward. In reverse order: Take 9 steps right. In reverse order: Take 10 steps backwards. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It will take you 4 steps to get back to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Let's say you take 6 - 4 = 2 steps and turn around. So to return to the starting point you would take 4 + 2 = 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 1 step before returning, you are facing back to the starting point. If you take 7 steps, the 6th step will be towards the beginning point. If you take 1 step then the 7th step will be toward the ending point. So, the answer is No.
